game.board.content

Class Grid

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.board.Grid

  • public class Grid
extends java.lang.Object
    A grid with contents on a Go game board. Created by erik.huizinga on 23-1-17.

      Construct a square Grid with single-side dimensions as specified.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Grid

        public Grid(int dim)
        Construct a square Grid with single-side dimensions as specified. The grid contains the playable part of the game board, initialised as Point.EMPTY, as well as the surrounding sides, initialised as Point.SIDE. Therefore, the playable grid has the dimension as specified, but with the boundaries included the full grid single-side dimension is the playable single-side dimension plus two.
        Parameters:
        dim - the playable grid single-side dimension.

    • Method Detail

      • getDim

        public int getDim()
        Returns:
        the single-side dimension of the playable grid.

      • init

        protected void init()
        Initialise the Grid by setting the content of the playable grid to Point.EMPTY, the content of the boundaries to Point.SIDE and initialise the sub2Ind and ind2Sub methods.

      • get

        public Content get(int ind)
        Get the Content of the Grid at the specified linear index.
        Parameters:
        ind - the linear index.
        Returns:
        the Content.

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the linear index.
